name: Shopify VIP Alerts: R√©sum√© AI & Notification Slack pour les Grandes Commandes
description:
# üß® Radar VIP : Rep√©rez et R√©sumez Instantan√©ment les Commandes Shopify de Grande Valeur avec AI + Alertes Slack

D√©tectez automatiquement lorsqu'une nouvelle commande Shopify d√©passe 200 $, r√©cup√©rez l'historique d'achats du client, g√©n√©rez un r√©sum√© aliment√© par l'IA et alertez votre √©quipe sur Slack‚Äîafin qu'aucun VIP ne passe inaper√ßu.

---

## üõ†Ô∏è Aper√ßu du Flux de Travail

| Fonctionnalit√©          | Description                                                                 |
|------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **D√©clencheur**        | Webhook ‚ÄúNouvelle Commande‚Äù Shopify                                        |
| **V√©rification Conditionnelle** | Filtres pour les commandes > 200                                        |
| **Enrichissement des Donn√©es** | R√©cup√®re l'historique complet des commandes du client depuis Shopify      |
| **R√©sum√© AI**         | Utilise OpenAI pour r√©sumer le comportement d'achat                        |
| **Notification**       | Envoie une alerte d√©taill√©e √† Slack avec le nom, le total de la commande et les informations sur le client |
| **Fallback**           | Ignore les commandes de faible valeur et termine le flux                   |

---

## üìò Ce que Fait Ce Flux de Travail

Cette automatisation surveille votre boutique Shopify et r√©agit √† toute **commande de grande valeur** (plus de 200 $). Lorsqu'elle est d√©clench√©e :

1. Elle r√©cup√®re toutes les **commandes pass√©es** de ce client,
2. R√©sume l'historique en utilisant **OpenAI**,
3. Envoie une alerte compl√®te avec contexte √† votre **canal Slack**.

Fini de deviner qui m√©rite un examen plus attentif. Votre √©quipe obtient des informations instantan√©es, et vos VIP re√ßoivent l'attention qu'ils m√©ritent.

---

## üß© D√©composition Node par Node

### üîî 1. D√©clencheur : Nouvelle Commande Shopify
- **Type** : `D√©clencheur Shopify`
- **√âv√©nement** : `orders/create`
- **But** : D√©marre le flux de travail sur une nouvelle commande
- **R√©cup√®re** : Total de la commande, ID du client, nom, etc.

### üî£ 2. D√©finir : Convertir le Total de la Commande en Nombre
- Assure que le `total_price` est trait√© comme un nombre pour la comparaison.

### ‚ùì 3. Si : La Commande > 200 $ ?
- **Condition** : `$json.total_price > 200`
- **Oui** ‚Üí Continuer
- **Non** ‚Üí Fin du flux de travail

### üîó 4. HTTP : R√©cup√©rer l'Historique des Commandes du Client
- Utilise l'**API Admin Shopify** pour r√©cup√©rer toutes les commandes de ce client.
- N√©cessite votre **jeton d'acc√®s Shopify**.

### üßæ 5. D√©finir : Convertir le Tableau des Commandes en Cha√Æne
- Formate les donn√©es de commande pour qu'elles soient adapt√©es √† OpenAI.

### üß† 6. Agent LangChain : R√©sumer l'Historique des Commandes
- **Invite** : `"R√©sumez l'historique des commandes du client pour Slack. Voici leurs donn√©es de commande : {{ $json.orders }}"`
- **Mod√®le** : GPT-4o Mini (personnalisable)

### üì® 7. Slack : Envoyer l'Alerte VIP
- Envoie un message riche √† un **canal Slack**.
- Inclut :
  - Nom du client
  - Valeur de la commande
  - R√©sum√© du comportement pass√©

### üß± 8. No-Op (Optionnel)
- Utilis√© pour terminer en toute s√©curit√© le flux de travail si la commande n'est pas de grande valeur.

---

## üîß Comment Personnaliser

| Quoi                     | Comment                                                              |
|--------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Seuil de commande        | Changez `200` dans le n≈ìud `Si`                                    |
| Canal Slack              | Mettez √† jour `channelId` dans le n≈ìud Slack                       |
| Style de l'invite AI     | Modifiez le texte dans le n≈ìud Agent LangChain                     |
| Jeton d'authentification Shopify | Remplacez `shpat_abc123xyz...` par votre v√©ritable jeton priv√©  |

---

## üöÄ Instructions de Configuration

1. Ouvrez l'**√©diteur n8n**.
2. Allez √† **Flux de Travail ‚Üí Importer ‚Üí Coller JSON**.
3. Collez ce JSON de flux de travail.
4. Remplacez votre **jeton Shopify** et vos **identifiants Slack**.
5. Enregistrez et activez.
6. Passez une commande test dans Shopify pour voir comment cela fonctionne.

---

## üí° Cas d'Utilisation R√©els

- üéØ Alerter l'√©quipe de vente lorsqu'un potentiel VIP ach√®te
- üõéÔ∏è Pr√©parer les repr√©sentants du support avec l'historique du client
- üìà D√©tecter les acheteurs r√©currents et les opportunit√©s de vente incitative

---

## üîó Ressources & Support

- üë®‚Äçüíª Cr√©ateur : [Yaron Been](https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/)
- üì∫ YouTube : [NoFluff avec Yaron Been](https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos)
- üåê Site Web : [https://nofluff.online](https://nofluff.online)
- üì© Contact : `Yaron@nofluff.online`

---

## üè∑Ô∏è √âtiquettes

`#shopify`, `#openai`, `#slack`, `#vip-customers`, `#automation`, `#n8n`, `#workflow`, `#ecommerce`, `#customer-insights`, `#ai-summaries`, `#gpt4o`

---

parameters.text:
=Summarize the customer's order history for Slack. Here is their order data:
{{ $json.orders }}

parameters.content:
# üîî High-Value Order Alert Workflow

**Description:**  
This workflow is designed to monitor incoming orders from a Shopify store. When an order exceeds $200, it automatically fetches the customer's order history, summarizes it using AI, and sends a personalized alert to a Slack channel. This ensures that high-value customers receive attention from the sales or support team in real-time.

---

## üü¢ Section 1: Shopify Order Trigger & Pre-Processing

This section initiates the workflow whenever a new order is placed in the Shopify store. The first step is detecting the new order event using the Shopify integration. Once an order is detected, the workflow proceeds to extract essential fields such as the order total and the customer ID.

The extracted order total is then evaluated against a threshold. If the amount is greater than $200, the workflow proceeds to the next section. Otherwise, it is terminated early to avoid unnecessary operations on low-value orders.

This section helps focus the workflow only on high-priority events and minimizes overhead by filtering out low-impact transactions.

---

## üß† Section 3: Customer Insights via AI

Once a high-value order is confirmed, this section is responsible for gathering historical context about the customer. The process begins with fetching the customer‚Äôs past order history from Shopify or a connected database using their unique customer ID.

The raw data containing previous order details‚Äîsuch as dates, product categories, and order amounts‚Äîis then cleaned and formatted into a prompt. This structured prompt is designed to be fed into an AI model for summarization.

An OpenAI chat model processes the prompt and generates a concise summary of the customer's purchasing behavior. This might include insights like frequency of purchases, favorite product categories, and overall customer lifetime value.

This AI-generated summary equips the team with actionable insights at a glance, enabling better personalization and response when the order alert is sent.

---

## üì£ Final Step: Slack Notification

The final section of the workflow sends a message to a designated Slack channel. The alert includes key details of the new high-value order along with the AI-generated summary of the customer. This ensures the team receives the context they need in real time, without having to dig through customer records manually.

---

## ‚õî Fallback: Low-Value Order

If the order total is $200 or less, the workflow ends here. No further action is taken. This fallback ensures that only orders worthy of escalation are processed, keeping the workflow efficient and focused.

---

## üîÅ Full Workflow Logic Overview

1. Detect a new order in Shopify.
2. Extract order details including total amount and customer ID.
3. Check if the order total exceeds $200.
4. If yes:
   - Fetch the customer‚Äôs past order history.
   - Format the data for AI.
   - Use OpenAI to summarize the customer‚Äôs behavior.
   - Send a detailed alert to Slack.
5. If not:
   - Terminate the workflow without sending an alert.

=======================================
            WORKFLOW ASSISTANCE
=======================================
For any questions or support, please contact:
    Yaron@nofluff.online

Explore more tips and tutorials here:
   - YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
   - LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
=======================================

üü¢ Shopify Order Trigger & Pre-Processing
üéØ Purpose:
To detect new incoming orders from the Shopify store and extract key data, especially the order total, for conditional routing.

üß© Nodes Involved:
New Shopify Order

Type: Trigger Node

Function: Listens for new orders placed on the Shopify store.

Data Pulled: Order ID, Customer ID, Order Total, Line Items, etc.

Extract Order Amount

Type: Field Editing Node

Function: Parses the incoming Shopify payload to isolate the order total and other relevant fields.

Output: Cleaned-up JSON or structured data (e.g., { customer_id: ..., total_amount: 215.00 })

üîÑ Workflow Flow:
A new order triggers the workflow.

The order's total amount is extracted and passed to the next stage for conditional evaluation.

‚úÖ Why It Matters:
Extracting the order amount early allows the workflow to make a smart decision: continue only for high-value transactions, saving processing resources and avoiding noise.

üß† Customer Insights via AI
üéØ Purpose:
To provide context on the customer's past purchase behavior using AI-generated summaries, so that the team receiving the alert understands the customer profile instantly.

üß© Nodes Involved:
Fetch Customer Order History

Type: HTTP Request

Function: Sends a request to your database or Shopify API to retrieve past orders for the customer.

Input: Customer ID

Output: List of past orders with dates, values, and product categories.

Prepare Order History Summary

Type: Edit Fields Node

Function: Formats and filters the fetched data into a prompt-friendly format for the AI model.

Example Output:

Customer 123 has made 4 purchases:
- $120 on June 10 (Shoes)
- $75 on July 2 (Accessories)
- $199 on August 15 (Electronics)
- $240 on September 5 (Apparel)
Summarize Order History

Type: OpenAI Chat Model

Function: Uses a language model (like GPT-4) to create a summary of the customer‚Äôs purchasing behavior.

Prompt Example:

"Summarize this customer's buying behavior in 1‚Äì2 sentences. Highlight their spending habits and preferences."

AI Summary Generator

Type: Tools Agent

Function: Manages the interaction between the workflow and the OpenAI model, ensuring context is handled correctly (e.g., memory or tools if needed).

üìã Example Output:
‚ÄúThis customer frequently purchases high-end fashion and electronics, with an increasing order value trend over the last 3 months.‚Äù

‚úÖ Why It Matters:
Gives your sales or support team instant, intelligent insights.

Saves time and reduces manual lookup of customer history.

Helps personalize responses and identify VIP customers.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
